root_files.title: Check STARLOG Project
root_files.content:
STARLOG System - Development Session Tracking Flow

Step 1: Check if directory is a STARLOG project
Use: check(path)

This verifies if the current directory is already set up as a STARLOG project.

root_files.title: Initialize or Orient
root_files.content:
Step 2: Setup project context

If NOT a STARLOG project:
→ Use: init_project(path, name, description) - Creates project structure with registries and HPI template

If IS a STARLOG project:
→ Use: orient(path) - Returns full Captain's Log XML context for existing projects

root_files.title: Start STARLOG Session
root_files.content:
Step 3: Begin tracked development session
Use: start_starlog(session_data, path)

Begin tracked development session with goals and context. This starts the formal logging process.

root_files.title: Work Loop - Development Activities
root_files.content:
Step 4: Work Loop - Choose tools as needed during development:

• update_debug_diary(entry, path) - Log real-time discoveries, bugs, insights during work
• view_debug_diary(path) - Check current project status and recent entries  
• view_starlog(path) - Review session history and past work
• rules(path) - View project guidelines and standards
• add_rule(rule, path) - Create new project guideline or standard

Use these tools throughout your development work to track progress and maintain documentation.

root_files.title: End STARLOG Session
root_files.content:
Step 5: Complete session with summary
Use: end_starlog(session_id, summary, path)

Complete session with summary and outcomes. This formally closes the development session and saves all context.

STARLOG creates Captain's Log style XML output for AI context injection.
